Container.Name: mcp-ssh-sre
Container.Overview:
MCP server providing secure, read-only SSH access for AI assistants like Claude. Ask natural language questions about your Unraid server:
- "Why is my Plex container crashing?" - "Is my array healthy? Any drives showing signs of failure?" - "Which containers are consuming the most resources?" - "Help me debug network connectivity between containers"
Features 12 tool modules with 79+ actions covering Docker management, storage/array health, system monitoring, log analysis, VM management, and security auditing. Auto-detects Unraid for platform-specific features like parity status, SMART data, and mover logs.
SETUP: Create a dedicated read-only SSH user (mcp-readonly) and generate an SSH key pair. The container connects via SSH to run diagnostic commands.

Config.Name: HTTP Port
Config.Description: MCP HTTP endpoint port. Connect your AI client to http://unraid-ip:3000/mcp

Config.Name: SSH Private Key
Config.Description: Path to SSH private key file on the host. Create with: ssh-keygen -t ed25519 -f /root/.ssh/id_rsa_mcp

Config.Name: SSH Host
Config.Description: SSH host to connect to. Use 'localhost' when running on Unraid itself (with host network mode).

Config.Name: SSH Username
Config.Description: SSH username. Create a dedicated read-only user for security.

Config.Name: Require Auth
Config.Description: Require OAuth authentication. Set 'false' for local network use, 'true' if exposing to internet.

Config.Name: SSH Port
Config.Description: SSH port on the target server.

Config.Name: OAuth Server URL
Config.Description: Your public URL when behind a reverse proxy (required if REQUIRE_AUTH=true). Example: https://mcp.yourdomain.com

Config.Name: Command Timeout
Config.Description: Command execution timeout in milliseconds. Increase for slow commands.
